Hi Jamie, 

Confirming that Rev Slider is now updated.
@heath All good now on this one. Cheers!

Hi Jamie,

Yes sure, no problems will do and update you in due course.

Hi Heath,

Thanks for the care reports this morning. Everything is looking great 😀

I'm just checking up on the Slider Rev plugin update. I realise that WP isn't flagging it to have an update however on the setting pages there is a notice showing there's an update so I've downloaded the latest version it directly from the theme forest. You can download it here - https://drive.google.com/open?id=1EFA7PyumqjN-g-9n1sCeTR5IToBs1z4d&authuser=jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au&usp=drive_fs

Can you please install the update?




Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

Hi Jamie, 

Ok sure, let me know how you go with RevSlider. We have removed the two scripts: lity.min.css / lity.min.js as they are not required.

Hi Heath,

All good. I think we might consult rev slider directly in this case. Leave it with me.

Do you know what the following scripts have been embedded for? Looks to be a light box.

lity.min.css
lity.min.js

Perhaps we don't require it anymore...


Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

Hi Jamie, 

Just confirming we removed the staging links earlier today.

Regarding the inline styles, sure I can see now that with VC being used, they were note required or less relevant. 

Regarding the Rev Slider video, we find it buggy too and try to avoid it on any of our sites. It's actually the most hacked plugin would you believe (probably due to its popularity). If you like we can look to hard code a better solution or you could check if there are any other plugins that you would consider using. Let me know your thoughts and I suggest for future builds to steer clear of it.

Hi Heath,

Just to add - there's still a number of file references to the staging site. Can you please fix these up on the live site?


Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek



Begin forwarded message:

From: Jamie Shek | Maker's Mark Creative <jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au>
Subject: Re: LAT25 map data entry
Date: 26 March 2019 at 6:34:07 pm AEDT
To: WP Perk Support <support@wpperk.com>

Hi Heath,

Thanks! You've saved my bacon. I had some big changes to make today but we got there. 😀

It wasn't the easiest to modify due to the way it was built - I had to do a little more coding than I would have liked too but that's okay. As previously mentioned we would like to take better advantage of the Visual Composer page builder next time for easy editing so we'll make that part of the brief.

FYI - I had to clean up the html on all of the maps entries as they contained lots of span tags with unnecessary inlines styles. I was editing them anyway so all good. Just a note for next time.

I'm still finding inconsistency with the performance of the rev slider bg video. I'm baffled as we have the same thing working just fine on Nuplas.

Is it autoplaying for you? It is for me, but not Spiro. It also doesn't autoplay for me in incognito or safari… I think it's worth further investigation. Any thoughts?

There's some page errors showing up in inspector so it might be to do with that. Any ideas what those might be?

We've adopted the URL - https://visitlatitude25.com.au/roadtrip/


Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

Thanks! I'm trying to source the remaining content today.

Can you please set all the links in the marker popups to open in a new tab? When clicked, the links currently error out in the iframe. I've set Bundidgerry Walking Track and that seems to do the job. If you could sweep through everything and set them the same that would be great.

Thanks 😀

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Jamie, 

Sure, we have maxed our this month's usage, it will take 1 to 2 hours and will be completed over the weekend. 

We will send you and email once it's ready to review.

Hi Heath,

Thanks for all the great work on this page so far. Now that the client has settled on the map format can you please update From Sydney and From Brisbane tabs to the same format and upload the outstanding content as per originally supplied?

https://docs.google.com/document/d/17bEteqiak9Hbe9Epd6S3j5HPApVKRoCo-aTTN06ZVOw/edit?usp=sharing

I know we might be pushing hours this month so please let me know if we're running over. We're happy to cover the extras so please don't let it hold you up 😀

This page is going live on Wednesday so hopefully there's not too many changes required. I'm away tomorrow and Monday so will only have Tuesday to add any last minute additions and itinerary images.

I'll be on email so let me know how your progressing. If you have any questions in the meantime Spiro is across this 😎

Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

On 11 Mar 2019, at 3:20 pm, Heath Maguire <heath@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi Jamie,

We have been working on the map and created the best solution within the constraints of the plugin. We opted for a 'tabbed' section to divide the routes up and I think it is a good solution.

Have a look and let me know what you think: https://visitlatitude25.com.au/making-our-way-to-latitude25/

As mentioned we can strip out the post type template so that the pop up only has the content and no header and footer elements.

Thanks and speak soon,

Heath Maguire
Director

E. heath@wpperk.com | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271

On 6 Mar 2019, at 3:42 pm, Jamie Shek | Maker's Mark Creative <jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au> wrote:

Hi Heath,

I've prepped all the map data require for input. I'm hoping it makes sense but its probably worth chatting through with you before you start so you can brief the team accordingly.

  1. Essentially there are 3 routes that have several stops along the way.
    • Melbourne to Latitude25
    • Sydney to Latitude25
    • Brisbane to Latitude25
  2. We'd like all the of the stops on each route to be connected by a blue line - like example below. In the google document it should be clear what points belong to which routes.
  3. In addition to the routes there are points of interest that can be added as stand alone. They don't need to be connected.
  4. I have images to include but they're a bit confusing so I'll add them later. Can you please use a placeholder for the time being?
  5. Please include the text provided for each stop and point of interest.

I think it might be best if we start with the first route (Melbourne to Latitude25) and we'll see how it comes together before progressing. What do you think?

Please call through when you've had a look so we can make sure we're on the same page 😀

https://docs.google.com/document/d/17bEteqiak9Hbe9Epd6S3j5HPApVKRoCo-aTTN06ZVOw/edit?usp=sharing


<Screen Shot 2019-03-05 at 9.47.48 am.png>

Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
